channel.title: Tool on D0CUM3NTN4T10N
channel.description: Recent content in Tool on D0CUM3NTN4T10N

item.title: Tshark Cheat Sheet
item.description: Basic Capture link tshark # -i: interface (default: eth0) tshark -i tun0 # --list-interface: List interfaces available tshark --list-interfaces # -r: Use a captured file tshark -r example.pcapng # Number of packets tshark -r example.pcapng | wc -l Filtering linkWe can filter packets using -Y option. Protocols link # HTTP tshark -Y 'http' # ICMP tshark -Y 'icmp' # TCP/UDP tshark -Y 'tcp' tshark -Y 'udp' IP Address link tshark -Y 'ip.

item.title: Convert PuTTY Key to OpenSSH Key
item.description: Install PuTTYgen linkIf you don’t have putty-tools on Linux, install it at first. # Install in Linux sudo apt install putty-tools If you use puttygen on Windows, install the PuTTYgen in the official page. Generate Key Pair link # -t: key type # -b: number of bits # -C: key comment # -o: output file puttygen -t rsa -b 2084 -C "user@example.com" -o keyfile.ppk PuTTY to SSH Key linkIf you use puttygen on Linux, run the following command to convert PuTTY key to OpenSSH keys (private/public).

item.title: Wireshark Cheat Sheet
item.description: Settings linkDatetime Format When Packets Sent linkSelect “View → Time Display Format → Date and Time of Day”. Filters linkEnter the following text in a filtering form. Datetime link frame.time >= "Jan 2, 2023 08:00:00" && frame.time <= "Jan 5, 2023 08:00:00" DNS link dns udp.port == 53 # Record type dns.qry.type == 1 # A record dns.qry.type == 2 # NS record dns.qry.type == 5 # CNAME record dns.qry.type == 6 # SOA record dns.
